channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Approximation of the thermodynamic limit of finite-gap solutions of the focusing NLS hierarchy by multisoliton solutions
item.description: arXiv:2408.13700v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we approximate the thermodynamic limit of finite-gap solutions to any integrable equations in the focusing NLS hierarchy (fNLS, mKdV, ...) with an associated multisoliton solutions using the Riemann-Hilbert Problem approach. Moreover, we show that both the finite-gap and multisoliton solutions are approximated in the thermodynamic limit by a generalization of the primitive potentials introduced by V. Zakharov and his collaborators in the KdV context. Under certain assumptions on the spectral data for the finite gap potentials, we provide error estimates for the approximation on compact subsets of the $(x,t)$-plane.
item.dc:creator: Robert Jenkins, Alexander Tovbis

item.title: On an integrable discretization of the massive Thirring model in light-cone coordinates and the associated Yang-Baxter map
item.description: arXiv:2408.13913v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a fully discrete analog of the massive Thirring model in light-cone coordinates by constructing its Lax-pair representation. This Lax-pair representation can also be used to define a new Yang-Baxter map, so we obtain a Yang-Baxter map that admits a continuous limit. We present most of the results for the general case where the dependent variables are matrix-valued.
item.dc:creator: Takayuki Tsuchida

item.title: On Symmetries of Finite Geometries
item.description: arXiv:2408.13973v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The isospectral set of the Dirac matrix D=d+d* consists of orthogonal Q for which Q* D Q is an equivalent Dirac matrix. It can serve as the symmetry of a finite geometry G. The symmetry is a subset of the orthogonal group or unitary group and isospectral Lax deformations produce commuting flows d/dt D=[B(g(D)),D] on this symmetry space. In this note, we remark that like in the Toda case, D_t=Q_t* D_0 Q_t with exp(-t g(D))=Q_t R_t solves the Lax system.
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knill

item.title: Generalized dessin partition function, cut-and-join type representation, and polynomiality
item.description: arXiv:2408.03212v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper we study the enumeration problem of a special kind of branched coverings of the Riemann sphere, whose partition function can be regarded as a generalization of the dessin partition function. First we derive a cut-and-join type representation for the generalized dessin partition function using the actions of $W$-type operators on Schur functions. Then we study the polynomial structures of the generalized dessin partition function. We prove a polynomial structure for the disconnected correlators which generalizes a result of Stanley, and then propose a conjectural polynomial structure for the connected correlators. We prove the $1$-point case of this conjecture using the KP integrability of this partition function.
item.dc:creator: Zhiyuan Wang, Chenglang Yang
